title: Thunderbird doesn't send mails from all accounts but one
content:
Good evening,

My SMTP server doesn't work correctly with Thunderbird.


I can without problems send messages from my j.klesyk@coursflorent.fr account that works with outlook and OWL add-on.


But since I've installed THE OWL: gmail and another account have stopped to send mails.

I can still RECEIVE without problems mails to all my accounts. But SENDING works only through OWL.


I join to this message the image of my SMTP servers.



Thank you very much for your help.

Sincerely,

J. Klesyk
creator: yzrkys

title: When I click on a button in a specific mail, the message pane gets blank
content:
I received a mail with the following content in a part of the message:

=0D 
 <a href=3D"https://form.typeform.com/to/zgTyl4LD#correo=3Dalcarraz@gmai=

l.com&nombre=3DAndr=C3=A9s Alcarraz&asesor=3DCecilia Rodrigo&ticket=3D718= 895"><button>Accede a la encuesta</button></a>=0D

=0D

It's a legitimate e-mail, when I click on the given button, the message pane turns blank, and it doesn't come back for any other mail I open.

When I click on it in a new message window, the same happens, but, only for that window.

It's not something that will give me any trouble since I don't think I will receive frequently, but it seems like a bug, not sure if this is the place to report it though. So if it's not please point me in the right direction, and thank you for thunderbird, it has been my main mail client since it exists. And Mozilla and Netscape before.

title: Thunderbird Message URI's changed / Lost previously opened Tabs
content:
So, I opened Thunderbird to a ton of new emails (1000+ being downloaded, I was away for a few weeks).

Mid-way through, Windows crashed, when I restarted the 50+ tabs I had open previously would not restore. I've tried the session.json delete etc, no luck.

However, I kept a copy of the old session.json and found 3-4 of the messages I used to have open. But the message URI's are completed different. The Inbox URI for one message used to be in the 97,000's and is now just over 24,000, likewise for messages from the Junk Folder.

I believe this is why the messages aren't opening, they are looking for URI's that no-longer exist (tried command-line opening and likewise no luck).

Is there any explanation as to why the URI's would suddenly change like that and/or how to work out the relationship between the old and new URI's?

Coupled with this, a number of emails I remembered from my tabs, when searched for, show up in the search window, but when I try to open them from the search results I get nothing, albeit the email itself is still physically present if I scroll to it's position and open it in the Inbox.

Any ideas?

title: Thunderbird 115 - Can't reduce size of Message List pane
content:
I've just upgraded to TB 115 (Supernova). Functionally, everything seems to be working as before. But using either "classic" or "wide" view, I seem to have lost the ability to resize the message list pane to take up less space on screen. Peviously, I had it set to show five message header lines, and now I can't get it to show less than eight (on "compact" density). That's wasting a significant amount of screen space, which is taken away from the message itself.

Before I report this as a bug, or revert to a previous version (since there's absolutely no sensible reason I can think of to enforce a minimum size of the message list pane, so I definitely want to get rid of it), is there something in the settings or config that I can use to override this behaviour?

title: Statuses of folders doesn't work
content:
Hi. I have a few problems with the newest version of thunderbird 115.3.0 (64bit), but I had the same problems with previous versions too.

When I get an email, the name of folder(s) become blue and bold, an orange star appears and the number of unread emails increases. But when I click something (doesn't matter what) or slide a scroll, the name of the folder becomes black as it was on the beginning and the orange star disappears. When I click the name of the folder it again is marked with an orange star.

Very often I don't receive email, but I should. I press "Get Messages" button, I see "no new messages" at the bottom of the window. I repeat it a few times and every time the result is the same. After 30 seconds or few minutes Thunderbird starts receiving messages from the last 2 hours.

We noticed very similar behaviour on a several computers. I was tested also in safe-mode and everything looks the same.

title: Dopo l'upgrade a Thunderbird Supernova non riesco ad abilitare la nuova visualizzazione
content:
Salve.

Premesso che ho ancora Windows 10, che però tengo sistematicamente aggiornato, ho appena eseguito l'upgrade di Thunderbird alla versione Supernova seguendo l'invito che mi è arrivato per email. La stessa email dà le prime istruzioni per configurare la visualizzazione nel nuovo modo, precisando che inizialmente resta impostata la vecchia modalità perchè l'utente potrebbe non voler cambiare subito. Io invece vorrei, ma non riesco, perchè se vado su Visualizza - Struttura tutte le opzioni sono ghostate salvo "Mostra il pannello Oggi" (vedi immagine). Mi è impossibile quindi adottare la nuova visualizzazione, come invece dicono le istruzioni nella email. Leggo poi da una risposta ad altro problema che la nuova versione non sarebbe indicata come upgrade, ma di questo nella email non c'era traccia, anzi, c'erano proprio le istruzioni da seguire per eseguire l'upgrade!

Grazie per l'aiuto.
creator: musicante-ritmico

title: Incorrect e-mails in Thunderbird
content: When I click on an e-mail in my Thunderbird Inbox, I sometimes receive the wrong e-mail - something from another user, or from the same user but a different e-mail (different, time, date, text, etc.). How can I stop this happening - it's more than inconvenient!
creator: olivertringham

title: Problema con lo scroll UP/Down della rotella su Thunderbird dopo l'ultimo aggiornamento
content:
Salve, prima dell'aggiornamento, ero abituato a utilizzare la rotella del mouse per scorrere le email nella mia casella di posta in modo molto comodo. Tuttavia, dopo l'ultimo aggiornamento di Thunderbird, questo comportamento è cambiato. 

Ora, quando provo a utilizzare la rotella del mouse per scorrere verso l'alto o verso il basso nella lista delle email o nel contenuto di un messaggio, non accade nulla. Devo effettuare lo scroll manualmente utilizzando la barra di scorrimento sul lato dell'applicazione, il che è scomodo e meno efficiente.

Ho verificato che il problema non sia legato al mio mouse o al driver del mouse, poiché lo scroll funziona correttamente in altre applicazioni e sul mio sistema operativo.

Chiedo gentilmente se potresti aiutarmi a risolvere questo problema o se hai conoscenza di una soluzione temporanea che potrei utilizzare mentre aspetto una correzione da parte del team di sviluppo di Thunderbird.
creator: lasersoft2019

title: eventi calendario thunderbird 115 - si spostano
content:
Stiamo riscontrando in azieda dei problemi sul calendario. In Thunderbird mappiamo un nostro calendario di rete presente sul server di posta principale.

Fatti i seguenti test: 1) creazione evento su calendario della webmail del prodotto di posta. Scaricando il file ics appare così

BEGIN:VEVENT SUMMARY:alberto_webmail UID:573b6369d387 X-SERVER-UID:573b6369d387 DTSTART;TZID=Europe/Amsterdam:20230927T140000 DTEND;TZID=Europe/Amsterdam:20230927T143000 CREATED:20230927T102720Z LAST-MODIFIED:20230927T102720Z DTSTAMP:20230927T102720Z PRIORITY:0 SEQUENCE:0 CLASS:PUBLIC X-MICROSOFT-CDO-BUSYSTATUS:busy TRANSP:OPAQUE END:VEVENT


provando a fare la stessa cosa da thunderbird 115 su windows: BEGIN:VEVENT SUMMARY:alberto_thunderbirdpc UID:e4ce0528-d945-4032-83d8-e654ad9d713e X-SERVER-UID:573b6374d3e5 DTSTART;TZID=Europe/Rome:20230919T070000 DTEND;TZID=Europe/Rome:20230919T080000 CREATED:20230927T102741Z LAST-MODIFIED:20230927T102741Z DTSTAMP:20230927T102741Z PRIORITY:0 SEQUENCE:0 CLASS:PUBLIC X-MICROSOFT-CDO-BUSYSTATUS:busy TRANSP:OPAQUE END:VEVENT

19 settembre !

Provando da un pc linux con un vecchio thunderbird:

BEGIN:VEVENT SUMMARY:alberto_thunderbird_fedora UID:3b6b48d5-ab49-4167-abe1-f40f688d0953 X-SERVER-UID:573b6387d495 DTSTART;TZID=Europe/Rome:20230927T161500 DTEND;TZID=Europe/Rome:20230927T171500 CREATED:20230927T102815Z LAST-MODIFIED:20230927T102815Z DTSTAMP:20230927T102815Z PRIORITY:0 SEQUENCE:0 CLASS:PUBLIC X-MICROSOFT-CDO-BUSYSTATUS:busy TRANSP:OPAQUE END:VEVENT END:VCALENDAR

title: Got 400 error on attempt to setup Gmail account in Thunderbird
content:
I found a few similar problems on the internet but none of the answers can actually fixed my problems. I can only add 1 Gmail account for personal and the Work account cannot be added due error 400. I also have a custom domain account selfhosting so I don't think it is Thunderbird fault.

1. I have no VPN 2. I use no firewall 3. I use the latest Thunderbird 115 4. I made sure to clear caches 5. I do not accept cookies from anysite 6. I always use Mozilla recommend config for Gmail which is SSL/TLS and OAuth2 7. IMAP is turned on 8. This is the link has 400 error (I got this after enter the correct login email), see [1] 9. I have apache2 server for web deverlopment, and there was an answer in here suggested that it might block Thunderbird from receive Google Token. So I disable the apache2 but still nothing change.

title: running the program

I've looked at the pages but haven't yet been able to get the program to work again. I have another Thunderbird program that does work. creator: tomfluce

title: Thunderbird 115.2.3   "S-L-O-O-O-O-W"   Performance on Ubuntu 23.10. What gives???
content:
Dear Thunderbird Community,

I am a die hard fan of the Thunderbird Mail Client, particularly on Ubuntu-based operating systems and have been a loyal user for years. However, with each new "upgrade" or "improvement", it seems to me there is always that lurking problem of HANGING SLOWNESS.

Why do I frequently get these warning signs of "BUSY" or "FORCE QUIT" "WAIT", on a routine basis. Yes, my HP Spectre x360 laptop is from 2016, and it's aging a bit; but I only have the Firefox Developer Edition browser open at the same time as my Thunderbird Client.

It's not like I'm using all of the systems resources. So, why the frequency of hanging slowness? It's very frustrating when you're inspired by an email message that you're quickly typing down and your thought process is rudely interrupted, because you're waiting for the Thunderbird Mail Client app to return to normal?

Is there something inherently going on in the background is that is slowing down this app's performance? It's a very bizarre problems that really affects your daily productivity and communication goals.

Please shed insight or provide tips and/or advice.

Thanks!
creator: MrPina

title: Thunderbird 115 date issues
content:
The today pane does not always advance to next day when the computer is in sleep/hibernate mode before midnight.

It sounds like this bug https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1589023 but this was closed 4 years ago and was reported as fixed.

Thunderbird 115.2.3 flatpack on Linux Mint 21.2 Victoria
creator: bananabob

title: Thunderbird - Can't send or receive emails
content:
Hello,

I have not been able to send or receive emails for the past 4 days using Thunderbird.

Before I went on vacation on Friday 22nd September 2023, I was able to send and receive my emails on my wendyp@wn.com.au address using Thunderbird on my computer. Since I got back on Monday (25th) I have not been able to send or receive any emails. Nothing has been changed in the Thunderbird settings.

At first, I thought Thunderbird might need to be updates. I did an update, to no avail. Current Thunderbird version is 115.2.3 (64bit). My computer is running Windows 10.

I use Bitdefender for protection and I turned off the virus and firewall to see if that helped, but it didn't.

I don't believe it is my actual webmail server, as I have been able to get my wendyp emails through my Android phone and by logging into my webmail account. I have also been able to send emails, with no issues using this method as well.

The strange thing is, I have another email address (page3@westnet.com.au) on the same Thunderbird program on my computer, and that one is having no problems whatsoever. Again, both settings have not been touched in the past few days.

Please find attached screen shots of the alerts from my wendyp@wn.com.au account.

The first attachment is when I try to request new emails from the server on Thunderbird.

The second attachment is when I try to send an email using Thunderbird.

The third attachment are my wendyp@wn.com.au email settings, which I have not changed at all.

I hope to hear from you soon, so this can be rectified.

Thank you - Wendy Page
creator: isthisurcard3

title: OTR for Thunderbird
content: Hello everyone. Tell me who knows. When verifying an account using otr, an error occurs in the following: when I try to verify a contact, the verification button is highlighted in gray. That is, a friend sends me a request, but I can't verify it! I will also note that I have already corrected the preferences/advanced/config editor file and studied this page https://wiki.mozilla.org/Thunderbird:OTR but nothing helped. Thank you in advance if you can help fix this moment. I'm using the XMPP protocol.
creator: frantsyzof
